intro: Chamaesyce portulana, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant has alternate, oval-shaped leaves with a rough texture and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world. Chamaesyce portulana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
